q: . Kyle Korver was mobbed by his wildly celebrating teammates. Boston players sat dazed on the bench. A third overtime was on deck. Allen Iverson simply pumped his fist, his face expressionless as if he expected it. Kyle Korver hit that big shot and I was thinking, "If he hit that shot, we've got to win it, he said. Mr Eric Schmidt said that Google had strengthened procedures to ensure that controversial issues such as StreetView( where Google's camera cars inadvertently collected personal data) were not repeated. It is reality that when we release products we have to be sensitive to regulatory and privacy issues, he said. "So we now do extensive reviews[ and] we're pretty happy with that balance now. executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role-- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. "It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat," Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google Inc. 's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.

"That's my life," Allen Iverson said. That's just what I've been going through since I've been in the league, so I'm kind of used to it. When we lose, people are going to point the finger at me and coach. And when we win gaems, I get the praise. You just accept that and understand that's the way it's going to be. Egypt, added the statement, recognized and appreciated the care accorded by Germany to the painted limestone bust of the famous ancient Egyptian queen, but added: Egypt is confident that the German authorities will assist in facilitating its return. The government and people of Egypt are eager that this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people. If returned, Zahi Hawass said, the bust will be exhibited at a new museum south of Cairo.
